==German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|de|ieder}} {{qualifier|obsolete}} ===Etymology=== From {{etyl|gmh|de}} {{m|gmh|ieweder}}, from {{etyl|goh|de}} {{m|goh|ioweder}}, from {{m|goh|io}} + {{m|goh|wedar}}, from {{etyl|gem-pro|de}} {{m|gem-pro|*aiwaz}} + {{m|gem-pro|*hwaþeraz}}. Compare {{cog|en|either}}, {{cog|nl|ieder}}. Around the 14th century, the word merged with {{m|de|ieder}}, at which point the dual sense, "both", died out. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈjeːdɐ/}} * {{audio|de|De-jeder.ogg|Audio}} ===Pronoun=== {{head|de|pronoun}} # [[each]] #: {{ux|de|'''Jedem''' das Seine|To each his own}} ====Synonyms==== * {{l|de|jedweder}} ===Adjective=== {{head|de|adjective}} # [[each]], [[every]] #: {{ux|de|'''Jedes''' Mal|Each time}} ====Synonyms==== * {{l|de|jedweder}} ===Declension=== {{de-decl-jeder}} *There's also a plural, jede/jeder/jeden/jede, which is used when it describes an interval, spacing, etc. and it modifies a word in the plural. For example ‘jede zwei Tage’ (every two days) is more standard than ‘jeder zwei Tage’. ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Norn== ===Noun=== {{head|nrn|noun}} # venom, poison # evil-speaking words # biting cold
